title: Snipe Dales
text:
Snipe Dales is a <a href="country%20park">country park</a> and <a href="Local%20Nature%20Reserve">nature reserve</a> in the <a href="Lincolnshire%20Wolds">Lincolnshire Wolds</a> near <a href="Hagworthingham">Hagworthingham</a> in <a href="Lincolnshire">Lincolnshire</a>, England. The reserve is one of the few remaining examples showing the Wolds as they were.
Snipe Dales comprises a raised heathland nature reserve at the west and a semi-natural mostly coniferous woodland country park at the east. It is located within a steep sided valley containing many small streams, sourced from springs, flowing into a larger stream that becomes a tributary of the <a href="River%20Lymn">River Lymn</a>.
The country park is in total of which 90 is woodland previously owned by the <a href="Forestry%20Commission">Forestry Commission</a> and now by <a href="Lincolnshire%20County%20Council">Lincolnshire County Council</a>. The nature reserve and park is jointly managed by the County Council and <a href="Lincolnshire%20Wildlife%20Trust">Lincolnshire Wildlife Trust</a> with help from volunteers. Access is by foot or wheelchair only, although there is a car park with visitor facilities. Dogs are allowed on a short lead in the country park but not in the reserve.
The <a href="Prime%20Meridian">Prime Meridian</a> runs through Snipe Dales and a plaque is at its intersection.
